subdivision_of_building: One outdoor natural grass tennis court.
description: Conversion of one natural grass tennis court to 3nos outdoor all weather floodlight padel courts with 12nos LED floodlights, 4m high enclosure and associated pathways,

decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The lighting hereby permitted shall be switched off when the courts that they serve are not in use. Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the area and accord with Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.

The padel courts to which this permission relates shall not open/be used outside of the following hours:08.30am - 9.30pm Monday to Friday08.30am - 9.30pm on Saturdays08.30am - 9.30pm on Sundays and bank holidaysReason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The padel courts hereby permitted shall not be used until evidence (photographs) is submitted to demonstrate that the padel courts has been built as described with porous materials as stated in the submitted and approved Design and Access Statement (22nd Mar 2024, Sports Facility Planning and Design Ltd).Reason: To comply with the National Planning Policy Framework (Paragraph 173), along with associated guidance to these policies and Kingston Council's Core Strategy Policy DM4.

Prior beneficial use of the development to which this permission relates, a Fire Safety Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The Fire Safety Strategy shall demonstrate how the development will achieve the highest standards of fire safety and shall include the following details:1) suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point; 2) Appropriate fire alarm systems; 3) Passive and active fire safety measures; 4) appropriate construction details to minimise the risk of fire spread; 5) provision of suitable and convenient means of escape/ an evacuation strategy; 6) provision of suitable access and equipment for firefighting which is appropriate for the size and use of the development. The Fire Safety Strategy shall include a statement of competence. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Strategy and thereafter maintained. The required Fire Safety Strategy shall reference the London Plan Guidance Fire Safety (February 2022), where applicable and a Reasonable Exception Statement (RES) shall be submitted in relation to those fire safety requirements which the applicant does not consider to be relevant. Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 (Fire Safety) of the London Plan 2021.
